boardgame.name: Hotel Mystery
Mord im Arosa
boardgame.description: From the game rules:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;A thriller in the MYSTERY TOWER for 2 to 6 good noses ears,10 years and up, by Alessandro Zucchini_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Night in the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Arosa_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; hotel. Creaking floor boards, banging window shutters, strange noises. Behind the wafer-thin walls, no sound remains hidden from eavesdropping ears._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Suddenly: a bang! A scream! Hurried steps fade away_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;thinsp;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;hellip; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Nobody saw anything! But everybody heard everybody else_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;thinsp;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;hellip; There are clues from the hotel guests on all floors. But which of them will be discovered? And which of them will remain hidden? If you don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;t want a murder rap pinned on you, you should lay the blame on the other players instead. Because one thing is for sure: the overwhelming evidence will convict the culprit._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The players arouse suspicion: they throw their clues (in the form of little wooden cubes) into the shaft of the hotel tower. If you prick up your ears, you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;lsquo;ll be able to guess on which floors the suspicious clues come to rest. With this knowledge, you can denounce other players and cover your own tracks._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The culprit is the one who has left particularly suspicious clues in the vicinity of the scene of the crime. Whoever attracts the fewest suspicious facts, wins._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Contents:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;1 hotel (8 parts)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;2 victims (red)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;120 clues in 6 colors_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;1 investigation sheet_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

The missing blue cube won_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t affect your game play-- I don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t think it is likely that a color would be close to running out of their cubes, and if blue does, then you can use any blue object to be sub as one of the blue cubes that is placed on the board, rather than into the tower.
